Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians, who finished the regular season strong at home with a 50-30 record, are looking to capitalize on their success against the Tigers, having won three previous meetings with Tanner Bibee on the mound this season.
Cleveland’s offense, led by José Ramírez, should be able to take advantage of Tyler Holton's limited experience in starting high-pressure games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the ALDS Game 1 between the Cleveland Guardians and the Detroit Tigers, taking place on October 5, 2024, at Progressive Field.
The Guardians have a well-balanced lineup and one of the best home records in the AL.
Tanner Bibee has consistently kept the Tigers' lineup in check, contributing to three Cleveland victories in his starts against them.
The Tigers, who finished tied with Kansas City in the AL Central standings at 86-76, enter the postseason after winning two of their last three games against Houston.
Others: The pick for the series opener is the Cleveland Guardians moneyline (-155).
